snippet: In a statement, the World Food Program, the main United Nations anti-hunger agency, said $675 million pledged would allow it to “fully reinstate” the reduced aid.
abstract: World Food Program, anti-hunger agency for United Nations, plans to restore food aid to Syrian refugees in Jordan, Lebanon, Iraq and Egypt for rest of 2016 using $675 million pledged at London donor conference.
lead_paragraph: In a statement, the World Food Program, the main United Nations anti-hunger agency, said $675 million pledged would allow it to “fully reinstate” the reduced aid.

headline.main: Syria: United Nations Says Food Aid Will Be Restored
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Syria: United Nations Says Food Aid Will Be Restored
